article.title: Drying and Wetting Transitions of a Lennard-Jones Fluid: Simulations and Density Functional Theory

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 shows DFT results for a Lennard-Jones fluid at a single LR wall. What information is plotted in the top panel of the figure?

Figure 6 shows DFT results for a Lennard-Jones fluid confined in a slit of width D=30σ. What happens to the height of the maximum in the local compressibility as the wall-fluid attraction strength w is reduced?
Figure 7 shows simulation results for lnP(ρ) for the modified 9-3 potential at various wall strengths w. What does the dashed line in both panels represent?
choices: lnP(ρ) for a fully periodic cubic system of size V = (15σ)^3
lnP(ρ) for a slit system at vapor-liquid coexistence
The coexistence form of lnP(ρ) for the modified 9-3 potential
The coexistence form of lnP(ρ) for the SR potential

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (30) describes the equilibrium thickness of the drying film (leq) in the limit of complete drying (δµ=0+). According to this equation, how does leq diverge as the wall strength w approaches zero?
choices: As a power law with an exponent of -1/2
